Class GameModel

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc11.model.GameModel
public class GameModel extends Object
Represents the main model of the game Galaxy Trucker. It holds the state of the game, including players, decks, ship cards, and the game board.

The GameModel manages all game phases: setup, ship building, and flight.

    Constructs a new GameModel instance with a given number of players.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameModel

      public GameModel(int numPlayers)
      Constructs a new GameModel instance with a given number of players. Initializes all the game components, including loading ship and adventure cards, generating a UUID, and creating dice.
      Parameters:
      numPlayers - the number of players in the game

  • Method Details

    • getID

      public String getID()
      Returns the unique ID of this game instance.
      Returns:
      the UUID as a string.

    • setLevel

      public void setLevel(FlightBoard.Type flightType) throws NullPointerException, IllegalArgumentException
      Initializes the flight board and corresponding adventure decks for the given level type.
      Parameters:
      flightType - the type of flight level (TRIAL or LEVEL2).
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if flightType is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the flight type is invalid.
      IllegalStateException - if the flight board was already initialized.

    • getFlightBoard

      public FlightBoard getFlightBoard()
      Returns the current flight board.
      Returns:
      the flight board.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the board has not been initialized.

    • getValDice1

      public int getValDice1()
      Rolls the first dice.
      Returns:
      the result of the roll (1-6).

    • getValDice2

      public int getValDice2()
      Rolls the second dice.
      Returns:
      the result of the roll (1-6).

    • checkPlayerUsername

      public void checkPlayerUsername(String username)
      Checks if a player with the given username exists.
      Parameters:
      username - the player's username.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the username is invalid or not found.

    • getHeldShipCard

      public ShipCard getHeldShipCard(String username)
      Returns the ship card currently held by the specified player.
      Parameters:
      username - the player's username.
      Returns:
      the ShipCard held by the player.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player does not hold a ship card.

    • setHeldShipCard

      public void setHeldShipCard(ShipCard shipCard, String username)
      Assigns a ship card to the specified player.

      Used primarily for testing purposes. If the player is not already holding a ship card, the card is oriented and registered as held.

      Parameters:
      shipCard - the ship card to assign.
      username - the player's username.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the card is null, the player is already holding a ship card, or the player is observing a mini deck.

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(String username) throws FullLobbyException, UsernameAlreadyTakenException
      Adds a new player to the game.
      Parameters:
      username - the player's username.
      Throws:
      FullLobbyException - if the lobby is already full.
      UsernameAlreadyTakenException - if the username is already in use.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the username is null or empty.

    • isFullLobby

      public boolean isFullLobby()
      Returns true if the number of players has reached the maximum allowed.
      Returns:
      true if the lobby is full.

    • getMaxNumPlayers

      public int getMaxNumPlayers()
      Returns the maximum number of players for this game instance.
      Returns:
      the maximum number of players.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer(String username)
      Retrieves the player with the specified username.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player to retrieve.
      Returns:
      the Player object associated with the username.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player is not found.

    • getPlayersNotAbort

      public ArrayList<Player> getPlayersNotAbort()
      Returns the list of players who have not aborted the game.
      Returns:
      list of active (non-aborting) players.

    • getAllPlayers

      public ArrayList<Player> getAllPlayers()
      Returns all players in the game, including those who have aborted.
      Returns:
      the list of all players.

      Returns the last player in the player list (e.g., the most recently added).
      Returns:
      the last Player in the list.

    • setPlayerColor

      public void setPlayerColor(String username, String color)
      Assigns a color to a player.
      Parameters:
      username - the player choosing the color.
      color - the color to assign (must be available).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the color is already taken or player already has a color.

    • isGameStarted

      public boolean isGameStarted()
      Returns whether the game has started.
      Returns:
      true if the game has started, false otherwise.

      Sets the game started status.
      Parameters:
      gameStarted - true if the game is to be marked as started.

    • addCoins

      public void addCoins(String username, int amount)
      Adds coins to the specified player.
      Parameters:
      username - the player receiving the coins.
      amount - the number of coins to add (must be non-negative).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the amount is negative or player is not found.

    • removeCoins

      public void removeCoins(String username, int amount)
      Removes coins from the specified player.
      Parameters:
      username - the player losing the coins.
      amount - the number of coins to remove (must be non-negative).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the amount is negative or player is not found.

    • setAbort

      public void setAbort(String username)
      Sets the specified player to "abort" status.
      Parameters:
      username - the player who aborts.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player is not found.

    • getPlayerShipBoard

      public ShipBoard getPlayerShipBoard(String username)
      Returns the ShipBoard of the specified player.
      Parameters:
      username - the player's username.
      Returns:
      the ship board associated with the player.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player is not found.

    • observeMiniDeck

      public ArrayList<AdventureCard> observeMiniDeck(String username, int numDeck)
      Allows a player to observe a mini adventure deck.
      Parameters:
      username - the player requesting to observe.
      numDeck - the index of the mini deck to observe.
      Returns:
      the list of AdventureCard in the observed deck.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the deck number is invalid or if the player already holds a card or deck.
      IllegalStateException - if another player is already observing the deck.

    • releaseMiniDeck

      public void releaseMiniDeck(String username)
      Releases a mini deck previously held by the player.
      Parameters:
      username - the player's username.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player does not currently hold a mini deck.

    • createDefinitiveDeck

      public void createDefinitiveDeck()
      Combines all adventure mini decks into one definitive adventure deck and shuffles it.

    • setTestDeck

      public void setTestDeck(AdventureDeck testDeck)
      Sets the definitive deck directly (used for testing purposes).
      Parameters:
      testDeck - the AdventureDeck to assign as the definitive deck.

    • getDefinitiveDeck

      public AdventureDeck getDefinitiveDeck()

      Draws the top adventure card from the definitive deck.
      Returns:
      the top AdventureCard.

    • isDefinitiveDeckEmpty

      public Boolean isDefinitiveDeckEmpty()
      Checks if the definitive deck is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the definitive deck is empty, false otherwise.

    • getFreeShipCard

      public ShipCard getFreeShipCard(String username, ShipCard shipCard)
      Allows a player to draw a ship card from the pool of free cards. If shipCard is null, a random covered card will be drawn and uncovered.
      Parameters:
      username - the player drawing the card.
      shipCard - the specific card requested, or null to draw a random covered card.
      Returns:
      the drawn ShipCard, now uncovered and held by the player.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player already holds a card or the specified card is unavailable.
      IllegalStateException - if no covered ship cards are left when drawing randomly.

    • getFreeShipCardsCount

      public int getFreeShipCardsCount()
      Returns the number of free ship cards still available.
      Returns:
      the number of remaining ship cards in the central pile.

    • getFreeShipCards

      public List<ShipCard> getFreeShipCards()
      Returns a list of ship cards in the free pile that are already uncovered.
      Returns:
      a list of uncovered ShipCards.

    • releaseShipCard

      public void releaseShipCard(String username, ShipCard shipCard)
      Allows a player to return a held ship card back to the central pool.
      Parameters:
      username - the player returning the card.
      shipCard - the card to be released.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player does not hold the specified card.

    • reserveShipCard

      public ShipBoard reserveShipCard(String username, ShipCard shipCard)
      Reserves a ship card on the player's ship board without placing it.
      Parameters:
      username - the player reserving the card.
      shipCard - the card to reserve.
      Returns:
      the player's updated ShipBoard.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the card is not held by the player.

    • useReservedShipCard

      public ShipBoard useReservedShipCard(String username, ShipCard shipCard, ShipCard.Orientation orientation, int x, int y)
      Places a reserved ship card onto the player's ship board at the given position and orientation.
      Parameters:
      username - the player.
      shipCard - the reserved card.
      orientation - the orientation to place the card.
      x - the x-coordinate on the board.
      y - the y-coordinate on the board.
      Returns:
      the updated ShipBoard.

    • connectShipCardToPlayerShipBoard

      public ShipBoard connectShipCardToPlayerShipBoard(String username, ShipCard shipCard, ShipCard.Orientation orientation, int x, int y)
      Places a held ship card directly onto the ship board.
      Parameters:
      username - the player placing the card.
      shipCard - the card to place.
      orientation - the desired orientation.
      x - x-coordinate on the board.
      y - y-coordinate on the board.
      Returns:
      the updated ShipBoard.

    • removeShipCardFromPlayerShipBoard

      public ShipBoard removeShipCardFromPlayerShipBoard(String username, int x, int y)
      Removes a ship card from the ship board and returns it to the player's hand.
      Parameters:
      username - the player.
      x - x-coordinate of the card to remove.
      y - y-coordinate of the card to remove.
      Returns:
      the updated ShipBoard.

    • checkPlayerShip

      public boolean checkPlayerShip(String username)
      Validates whether the current ship layout of the player is structurally correct.
      Parameters:
      username - the player.
      Returns:
      true if the ship is valid, false otherwise.

    • getNumExposedConnectors

      public int getNumExposedConnectors(String username)
      Returns the number of exposed connectors in the player's ship.
      Parameters:
      username - the player.
      Returns:
      the number of exposed connectors.

    • move

      public void move(String username, int numDays)
      Moves a player forward or backward by a number of days, adjusting for collisions on the flight board.

      If the target position would collide with another active player, the move is adjusted to skip past them. This applies to both forward and backward movement.

      Parameters:
      username - the player to move.
      numDays - the number of days to move (positive or negative).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player is not found.

    • checkLapping

      public void checkLapping()
      Checks if the leading player has completed a lap over others, and marks those lapped as aborted.

      A player is considered lapped if the distance between their position and the leader exceeds the board length.

    • getPositionOnBoard

      public int getPositionOnBoard(String username)
      Returns the current modular position of the player on the flight board.
      Parameters:
      username - the player whose position is queried.
      Returns:
      the position modulo the length of the board.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player does not exist.

    • endBuildingTrial

      public void endBuildingTrial(String username)
      Marks the end of ship building phase for a player in trial mode, assigning their flight position.

      The player is placed in the first available position on the board, after those already placed.

      Parameters:
      username - the player finishing the trial build phase.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player does not exist.
      IllegalStateException - if the player already has a position assigned.

    • endBuildingLevel2

      public void endBuildingLevel2(String username, int pos)
      Marks the end of ship building phase for a player in level 2, assigning them a selected starting position.
      Parameters:
      username - the player finishing their build phase.
      pos - the desired starting position (1 to number of non-aborted players).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the position is invalid or already occupied.
